'''Michele Clapton''' is a costume designer from England, who has worked in both film and TV. She has found the most success designing for television period dramas, having worked on the costumes for ''Sense & Sensibility'', ''The Devilâ€™s Whore'', and ''The Diary of Anne Frank''.

She is the lead Costume Designer on [[Game of Thrones (TV series)|''Game of Thrones'']] (see "[[Costumes]]" for an overview of her work in the TV series).

On September 15, 2012 she won the [[wikipedia:Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Costumes for a Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Costumes for a Series]] for her work on the [[Season 2|second season]] of ''Game of Thrones'' (specifically the episode "[[The Prince of Winterfell]]").  It was the first Emmy award Clapton has received in her career.<ref>[http://www.westeros.org/GoT/News/Entry/Game_of_Thrones_Wins_Big_at_Creative_Arts_Emmys/ Westeros.org]</ref>. Clapton was also nominated for the the costume design Emmy for her work in Season 1 and Season 3 of ''Game of Thrones'', but did not win.

On August 16, 2014, Clapton won her second Emmy Award for Outstanding Costumes for a Series, for her work on [[Season 4]] of ''Game of Thrones'' (specifically the episode "[[The Lion and the Rose]]").<ref>"[http://watchersonthewall.com/game-thrones-competing-creative-arts-emmys-tonight/ Game of Thrones wins four Creative Arts Emmys]</ref>
